title: The Typographer's Library
content:
I have a small library (3 books, eh?) of books on typography. This includes:

_The Elements of Typographic style_ by Robert Bringhurst  
_Thinking with Type_ by Ellen Lupton  
_Stop Stealing Sheep and Find out how Type Works_ by Erik Spiekermann and E.M Ginger

What books would you recommend to add to this? Give a little review if you can.

Thanks,  
Evan  
 [www.evanmade.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/evanmade.com/)

comments.content:
I’ve never gone wrong randomly picking stuff out of the books list:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/12157](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/typophile.com/node/12157 "http://typophile.com/node/12157")
I really connect with Jost Hochuli. Check the Hyphen list.

That is quite the list — a bit overwhelming. What of those books have you read and what do you think? Why do you like them? For whom would you recommend them (i.e. type designers, graphic designers, editors, web developers, and so on)?

evan  
 [www.evanmade.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/evanmade.com/)

Here are some links to book reviews:

Typophile has a **Books** section which includes some reviews by fellow Typophiles... You can find it by going to the RESOURCES link at the top of this page, or by clicking [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/www.typophile.com/books).

The Type Directors Club has a [**Reviews**](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/www.tdc.org/reviews/index.html) section on its website.

The [**TypeBooks**](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/www.typebooks.org/) website hasn’t been updated since 2002, but that doesn’t mean you won’t find useful reviews there. :-)

Happy reading!

P.S. And speaking of Jost Hochuli, the English translation of his _Detail in typography_ is finally available from [Hyphen](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907013507/http:/www.hyphenpress.co.uk/)...
Typophile Books needs updating. Forgive the lack of new releases.
